intro: Heteropsis flexuosa, commonly known as the zigzag plant, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, zigzagging stems that give it its common name. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color, arranged in clusters along the stems. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often covered with fine hairs. Heteropsis flexuosa is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its unique appearance and adaptability to various growing conditions.
